commander.name: Pietro Maggiani
commander.previous_service: Regular Army officer, experienced in infantry command

Cannone da 75/27 Mod. 1911.note: 12th Artillery Regiment Savona - standard divisional field artillery

Mortaio da 81/14 Modello 35.note: Regimental 81mm mortar companies (6 per regiment x 2 regiments = 12) + divisional mortar battalion (24)

Mortaio da 45 Modello 35 (Brixia).note: Battalion support companies (18 per regiment x 2 regiments = 36) + regimental accompanying arms companies (18 per regiment x 2 regiments = 36) + militia legion (18)

supply_status.note: Supply situation adequate for Q4 1940 garrison duties in Gharyan. Division not engaged in combat operations during this quarter.

subordinate_units.unit_designation: Servizi di Sussistenza e Trasporti Automobilistici

tactical_doctrine.role: Static defensive infantry division tasked with coastal and interior garrison duties in western Libya. Not committed to mobile operations during 1940-Q4.
special_capabilities: Auto-transportable organization allowing limited motorized movement when transport allocated
Acclimatized to desert conditions through service in Libya since 1939
known_issues: Binary division structure (2 regiments vs 3) reduces infantry strength compared to older ternary organization
Insufficient integral motor transport to move entire division simultaneously
Limited anti-tank capability with only 8x 47mm guns for entire division
Lack of armored support (no organic tank or armored car units)
Weak anti-aircraft defense with only 4x 20mm guns
tactical_doctrine.desert_adaptations: Division maintained in garrison with focus on water conservation, heat management, and desert navigation training. Personnel equipped with tropical uniforms and desert boots.

scenario_suitability: Garrison duty and rear-area security operations
Training scenarios for Italian binary division structure
What-if scenarios for Italian defensive operations
special_rules: Static Defense: +1 to defensive combat when in prepared positions
Water Dependency: Desert operations require secure water supply lines
Limited Mobility: Movement rate reduced when operating without allocated transport
Binary Division: Reduced infantry strength compared to ternary divisions
historical_engagements: Garrison duties along French Tunisian-Libyan border (June 1940)
Not engaged in Operation Compass (Dec 1940 - Feb 1941)

source: TM E 30-420 Handbook on Italian Military Forces (August 1943) - Tier 1 primary source
Wikipedia article on 55th Infantry Division Savona - Tier 2 curated web source
Rommel's Riposte Order of Battle (November 1941) - Tier 2 specialized web source
Italian binary infantry division standard TO&E tables - Tier 1 technical manual
validation.validated_by: Claude Code Autonomous TO&E Extraction System
known_gaps: Individual officer names for subordinate unit commanders not available in sources
Chief of Staff name not identified in available sources
Exact operational readiness percentages for vehicles estimated based on typical Italian Army standards for 1940
Specific variants of some support vehicles (ambulances, workshop trucks) estimated based on standard Italian Army practice
NCO count calculated as approximately 24% of total personnel based on TM E 30-420 typical ratios
Water supply capacity estimated based on division size and desert garrison requirements
Individual soldier positions not documented at division level (requires battalion/company level detail)
notes: IMPORTANT CLARIFICATION: User requested '17ª Divisione di Fanteria Savona' but historical records show this division as the 55th Infantry Division 'Savona' (55ª Divisione di Fanteria 'Savona'). No 17th Division named Savona existed in Italian WWII order of battle.
Division structure based on standard Italian binary infantry division TO&E from TM E 30-420 para. 51
Personnel totals: 12,169 = standard binary division strength with militia legion attached
Artillery total 36 pieces validated: 24 field artillery (75mm) + 8 anti-tank (47mm) + 4 anti-aircraft (20mm)
Mortar total 126 validated: 36x 81mm + 90x 45mm across all infantry units
Ground vehicles total 1,937 includes all trucks, motorcycles, and support vehicles but excludes pack animals (363 mules/horses)
Commander Pietro Maggiani confirmed from multiple sources, served 1 Sep 1939 - 3 Nov 1941
Division remained in Gharyan garrison throughout Q4 1940, not engaged in combat operations
Auto-transportable classification means division had enhanced motor transport but not fully motorized
